alert.note: Alert for Brown (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 19 at 8:29PM CDT until May 21 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Brown. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 827 PM CDT, Radar indicated numerous thunderstorms with heavy rain across much of the northern half of Brown County. These storms were repeatedly tracking slowly to the east. Rainfall of one half to 1.5 inches has occurred, and up to an additional inch of rain is expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Brownwood, Blanket, Byrds, Lake Brownwood State Park, May, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Lake Brownwood, Grosvenor, Cross Cut, Owens and Thrifty. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... FM 1467 crossing Blanket Creek, FM 2273 crossing Rough Branch, CR 321 crossing Blanket Creek Branch, County Road 441 crossing Bledsoe Branch, County Road 362 crossing Blanket Creek and County Road 323 crossing Blanket Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
